ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cochlear Schwannoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss, disproportionately poor speech recognition (32%), and MRI confirmation of a left-sided basal turn cochlear schwannoma.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sudden Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of sudden onset hearing loss 10 months prior, though MRI findings confirmed a retrocochlear etiology.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and configuration given the complaint of hearing loss.
To evaluate word recognition abilities and screen for retrocochlear pathology.
To assess middle ear status, especially given the prior diagnosis of fluid.
To definitively evaluate the internal auditory canal and cerebellopontine angle for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a left moderately severe low-frequency sensorineural hearing loss rising to normal in the mid-frequencies. Word recognition in the left ear is extremely poor (32%) and disproportionate to the pure-tone thresholds, strongly suggesting retrocochlear pathology. Tympanometry shows bilateral negative pressure. MRI confirmed a small left-sided cochlear schwannoma.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal at 250 Hz, mild SNHL dip 500-1000 Hz, normal 2000-6000 Hz, mild loss at 8000 Hz. Left ear: Moderately severe SNHL 250-1000 Hz, rising to normal 2000-6000 Hz, mild loss at 8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear WRS 100%. Left ear WRS 32%, significantly worse than predicted by thresholds.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Ipsilateral present 500-2000 Hz Left. Contralateral elevated or absent. Decay negative at 1000 Hz.

tests.name: MRI
tests.result_summary: Small, left-sided basal turn cochlear schwannoma with internal auditory canal fundus involvement.

counseling_actions: Discuss MRI findings and the diagnosis of cochlear schwannoma
Review management options and the decision to wait and watch the tumor
Counsel on hearing protection to preserve remaining hearing

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for medical management and monitoring of the confirmed cochlear schwannoma.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor tumor status and hearing sensitivity.
